Posts.Content: Hi figkip The waiting is awful isn’t it?!!! My initial HER2 test came back borderline so I had to have another core biopsy done. They were only going to take 3 samples but I made them take 5 to be on the safe side.  I was due to have a lumpectomy and axillary node clearance but some minuscule calcified areas were found on one of my scans so they biopsied those too, luckily they were spotted by my eagled eyed consultant as they turned out to be precancerous. So my plan was changed so I’d have chemo first, then the op and then radiation. I had my 2nd cycle of EC-T yesterday and my HER2 results came back yesterday too. I’m HER2 negative. I asked my oncologist what that meant exactly and whether it would change my treatment plan and he said that the only difference it would make is that I won’t be given Herceptin.  I hope you get your results soon  Resa47 xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had a non-result from FISH (HER2) test???!

Posts.Content: I met this afternoon with my consultant and I have have my treatment plan. I was so worried that the cancer had spread but thank god it is contained in my left breast and nodes.  She will operate next week to remove the lump and auxiliary node clearance. 4 weeks later I’ll have chemo and then rads. When I’m all completely healed she will reconstruct my good Breast to look like the new improved cancer free one.  I know it’s gonna be a long hard road but for the first time since I found my lump last month I feel positive.  Theresa
Posts.Title: Saw my consultant today for my treatment plan

Posts.Content: Hi Taralou Welcome to the board!!! I am on EC-T too. Well done on your first cycle! My first one was last week and it was fine. I felt great for 2 days after but then the headaches and insomnia started. Luckily for me it only lasted 3 days and then I felt normal again.  Hopefully you’ll sail through without many side affect.  Keep us all posted  Theresa x
